intro: Menais, commonly known as the common menais, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, branching stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and have a slightly serrated edge. Menais thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
